etymologies: late 19th century. From scientific Latin Bruchus, genus name + -id, after scientific Latin Bruchidae, (former) family name (G. SamouelleEntomologist's Useful Compend 199, as alteration of earlier †Bruchides)

definitions: Any of the numerous small beetles constituting the subfamily Bruchinae (family Chrysomelidae), having larvae which develop within a single bean or seed. Also "bruchid beetle".

notes.text: Formerly regarded as a kind of weevil, and placed in a separate family Bruchidae.
